channel.title: java on Mariel's GitHub page
channel.description: Recent content in java on Mariel's GitHub page

item.title: Flowing like a stream
item.description: This has been a hectic period and as a consequence, I have neglected this blog. I had to push a temporary pause to my Java course, but I’m back. In this post, I’ll talk about the famous streams that I have never heard about, yet I have worked similar operations in other programming languages.

item.title: Interfaces
item.description: After some weeks of neglecting my self-study Java time, I finally got the time to get back on track this week and I reached the Interfaces topic. I learned this topic when I studied C# some years ago, but it’s not quite like that time.

item.title: Java Programming I MOOC
item.description: This weekend I finished the Java Programming I course offered as a MOOC by the University of Helsinki. Here are my thoughts after circa 6 weeks of Java. This is going to be a lengthy post, so if you feel like reading, let’s crack on.

item.title: Java - One month later
item.description: Some posts ago I published that I was embarking myself into learning Java. Today I realized that it’s been a month now! :open_mouth: My previous post was a bit opinionated on why I had never learned Java. It makes sense to write an update on this mission.

item.title: Java strikes back!
item.description: Java was supposed to be the first programming language I would learn. I remember it was around 2013 when I had the idea about learning how to program. As a good newbie, I downloaded the official Java development kit (JDK) and then… I never really got around it, until now 2022
